content:
Based on the execution logs, I'll generate a comprehensive report:

# EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining System (around x=40, y=-82)
Automated coal mining setup consisting of:
- Burner mining drill at (40.0, -82.0) mining coal
- Transport belt line running from y=-83.5 to y=-86.5 at x=39.5
- Fuel inserter at (38.5, -84.5) maintaining drill fuel
- Output collection inserter at (38.5, -86.5)
- Collection chest at (39.5, -87.5)

### Iron Plate Production Facility (around x=45-47, y=-80)
Two parallel smelting lines consisting of:
- Stone furnaces at (45.0, -80.0) and (47.0, -80.0)
- Output inserters at (45.5, -81.5) and (47.5, -81.5)
- Collection chests at (45.5, -82.5) and (47.5, -82.5)
- Input inserters at (45.5, -78.5) and (47.5, -78.5)
- Input chests at (45.5, -77.5) and (47.5, -77.5)

### Storage Area
- Coal storage chest at (49.5, -80.5) containing 800 coal
- Mixed storage chest at (49.5, -79.5) containing coal and iron plates

# ERROR TIPS
- Cannot connect transport belts directly to wooden chests - use inserters instead
- When building automated systems, ensure proper spacing between components to allow for inserter movement
- Keep track of chest capacities - several chests are showing "chest is full" warnings
- Monitor furnace fuel levels and input materials - furnaces showing "no ingredients to smelt" warnings
- When placing belts, maintain consistent direction to ensure proper flow

# NAMESPACE
Important Variables:
- mining_drill_status: EntityStatus
- fuel_levels: Dictionary[str, int]
- belt_positions: List[Position]
- inserter_positions: List[Position]

Functions:
- connect_entities(): Failed when attempting to connect belts to wooden chest
- create_belt_line(): Successfully created transport belt lines with consistent direction
- fix_inserter_rotation(): Successfully reoriented inserters for proper material flow
